title: Legal Counsel - Compliance & Corporate
content:
Teads is seeking a motivated and experienced Compliance & Corporate Legal Counsel to manage and coordinate corporate matters with the local entities and the holding company and ensure that our processes comply with ethical, ABC and ESG regulations and policies. The aim of this role is to foster an appropriate level of compliance and good governance within the Teads Group. It also requires working closely and harmoniously with different departments (finance, HR, sustainability, procurement).
RESPONSIBILITIES
Corporate (portfolio of +35 subsidiaries worldwide): 

Management and coordination of the legal and social life of the holding company (Luxembourg) and the group's subsidiaries for day-to-day operations (annual approval of accounts, updating of articles of association, follow-up, and review of delegations of authority granted, etc.),
Support the finance team in the incorporation of new subsidiaries, 
Management of KYC process, legalization of documents, verification of documentary requirements, management of translations, signatures, obtaining notary certifications and apostilles, 
Insurance: monitor exchanges with the broker  and renewals. 

Compliance: 

Implement and manage the Ethic & ABC Compliance plan: 

Anti-Bribery & Corruption (Sapin 2, FCP, whistleblowing, UK regulations, etc),
ESG (Environmental, social, and governance) in collaboration with the Sustainability Director, the HR and the Procurement departments. 

Draft and update related policies and contract templates, 
Regularly audit and assess company operations, procedures, practices, and documents to identify possible weaknesses or risks, or lack of compliance, 
Create and manage effective action plans in response to audit discoveries and compliance violations,
Create and lead training sessions, 
Resolve employees' and management concerns about compliance. 

REQUIREMENTS:

Master degree (+5) in Private law, Business law, Ethics and Compliance law, Corporate law. 
At least 3/5 years of experience in a compliance and corporate role in an international environment (group of companies, law firm or audit firm), 
Excellent English is imperative, both oral and written (fluency is essential), 
Knowledge of international regulations related to the scope (Sapin 2 is mandatory, FCPA, ABC Act, Anti-Money Laundering etc.. ) 
Rigor, involvement, reactivity, 
Sense of organization, priorities, and initiative, 
Able to work independently and with initiative, 
Able to make proposals to move complex projects forward, 
Enthusiastic, energetic and enjoy working in a team 

About Teads
Teads operates a leading, cloud-based, omnichannel platform that enables programmatic digital advertising across a global ecosystem of quality digital media.
As an end-to-end solution, Teads’ modular platform allows partners to leverage buy-side, sell-side, creative, data and AI optimization technologies. For advertisers and their agencies, Teads offers a single access point to buy the inventory of many of the world’s best publishers and content providers.
Through exclusive global media partnerships, Teads enables advertisers and agencies to reach billions of unique monthly users in brand safe, responsible advertising environments, while improving the effectiveness and efficiency of digital ad transactions.
Teads partners with the leading marketers, agencies and publishers through a team of 1,200+ people in 50 offices across more than 30 countries.
We're committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, and represents employees across a variety of skill sets. We embrace contributions from all ages, sexes, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations and gender identities.
